JumpScale.core.Application module¶

class JumpScale.core.Application.Application[source]¶
connectRedis()[source]¶
debug[source]¶
getAgentId()[source]¶
getCPUUsage()[source]¶

try to get cpu usage, if it doesn’t work will return 0 By default 0 for windows

getMemoryUsage()[source]¶

try to get memory usage, if it doesn’t work will return 0i By default 0 for windows

getUniqueMachineId()[source]¶

will look for network interface and return a hash calculated from lowest mac address from all physical nics

getWhoAmiStr()[source]¶
initGrid()[source]¶
initWhoAmI(reload=False)[source]¶
when in grid:
is gid,nid,pid
loadConfig()[source]¶
start(name=None, appdir='.')[source]¶

Start the application

You can only stop the application with return code 0 by calling j.Application.stop(). Don’t call sys.exit yourself, don’t try to run to end-of-script, I will find you anyway!

stop(exitcode=0)[source]¶

Stop the application cleanly using a given exitcode

@param exitcode: Exit code to use @type exitcode: number

writeExitcodeOnExit¶

Gets / sets if the exitcode has to be persisted on disk

class JumpScale.core.Application.WhoAmI¶

Bases: tuple

WhoAmI(gid, nid, pid)

gid¶

Alias for field number 0

nid¶

Alias for field number 1

pid¶

Alias for field number 2

Bases: object

Utility class to configure and store all relevant directory paths

Configuration file folder (appdir/cfg)

baseDir = None¶

Application installation base folder (basedir/apps)

deployDefaultFilesInSandbox()[source]¶
getPathOfRunningFunction(function)[source]¶
init(reinit=False)[source]¶

Initializes all the configured directories if needed

If a folder attribute is None, set its value to the corresponding default path.

@returns: Initialization success @rtype: bool

loadProtectedDirs()[source]¶

replaceFilesDirVars(path, recursive=True, filter=None, additionalArgs={})[source]¶
replaceTxtDirVars(txt, additionalArgs={})[source]¶

replace $base,$vardir,$cfgdir,$bindir,$codedir,$tmpdir,$logdir,$appdir with props of this class

JumpScale.core.Dirs.pathToUnicode(path)[source]¶

Convert path to unicode. Use the local filesystem encoding. Will return path unmodified if path already is unicode.

@param path: path to convert to unicode @type path: basestring @return: unicode path @rtype: unicode

JumpScale.core.Time module¶

Timestamp routines

class JumpScale.core.Time.TimeIntervalUnit[source]¶

Enumerator for time interval units

DAYS = 3¶
HOURS = 2¶
MICROSECONDS = -2¶
MILLISECONDS = -1¶
MINUTES = 1¶
MONTHS = 5¶
NANOSECONDS = -3¶
SECONDS = 0¶
WEEKS = 4¶
YEARS = 6¶
JumpScale.core.Time.getabstime()[source]¶

Get string representation of absolute time in milliseconds

JumpScale.core.Time.printdelta()[source]¶

This is a function for source code or performance debugging. Call this function at every point cut in the source code where you want to print out a timestamp, together with the source code line
